```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

library(tidyverse)
library(purrr)
library(ggpubr)
```

```{r}
# source plant growth function
source("../R/plant_growth.R")
```


```{r}
# generate data inputs, one for each week of the year
nsample = 52

# mean number of watering per week
water_mean = 2

# sd waterings per week
water_sd = 0.5

# waterings per week
water = rnorm(mean=water_mean, sd=water_sd, n=nsample)
summary(water)

# mean number of sun hours per week
sun_mean = 21

# sd sun hours per week
sun_sd = 7

# sun hours per week
sun = rnorm(mean=sun_mean, sd=sun_sd, n=nsample)
summary(sun)

```

```{r}
# create data frame for growth - do we want to sum or just do incremental growth
growth = as.data.frame(matrix(nrow=length(sun)), ncol=length(water))
```


```{r forloop}

for (i in 1:nrow()) {
  growth[,i] = plant_grow(sun=inputs$sun[i], water=inputs$water[i], pot=1)
  growth[,i] = growth[,i-1]
}

```
